label: 一本御書所
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
見出し読み: いっぽんのごしょどころ
説明文: A building in the Imperial Palace. This was where one copy of every ordinary book published in Japan was placed, since it was customary to donate one copy to the Sovereign (Tennō ). Hence its name meaning one volume honorable books place". [天皇]"
